articles.title: Kim Jong Il visits industrial establishments in Huichon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visits industrial establishments in Huichon
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave personal guidance to industrial establishments in Huichon, Jagang Province, on Monday.
   He visited the Youth Electric Complex, the Huichon General Machine Tool Plant and the February 26 Plant.
   He looked round workshops and learned about production and management. 
   He said the heroic workers of Korea are firmly defending socialism in high spirits, pulling through trials and difficulties under the slogan "Let us go with a smile even if we have a difficult way to go." he added that the final victory is guaranteed by the powerful independent national economy and the strong will of the workers.

articles.title: How far will Japan go in immoral conduct?
articles.content:
How far will Japan go in immoral conduct?
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- Japan is openly inciting militarism among people, while going ahead with legislative arrangements related to the "Japan-U.S. Defense Cooperation Guidelines" aimed at dominating Korea and the rest of Asia with military force.
   Japanese right-wingers have described Japan's history of aggression as a "just cause," released a movie praising top-class war criminals as "heroes" and deceived the rising generation into believing that massacres committed by the Japanese imperialists in Asian countries are "groundless."
   Surprisingly, they have alleged that some 200,000 women of Korea, china and other countries who were forced to serve as sex slaves for the Japanese army "responded to civilians' call for recruitment voluntarily or for money."
   Does the allegation stem from the Japanese rightist politicians' shamelessness and ignorance or did Japan really carry out  "just cause of liberating Asia" from the whites' domination?
   The answer has already been given by the stern judgement of history.
   The Japanese imperialists' aggression of Korea and China and the following pacific war were an unheard-of immoral crime prompted by Japan's ambition for conquering Asia and emerging as "world empire."
   For that purpose, the Japanese imperialists committed slaughters in southeast Asian countries. Especially, their crime against the Korean people is beyond human ken.
   During the occupation of Korea, they abducted and took away some 6 million young people and forced mediaeval labor on them and killed more than one million people in cold blood.
   Nearly 200,000 Korean women were kidnapped and forced to serve as sex slaves for the Japanese army. Many of them were dismembered or burnt to death.
   After the war, the far eastern international tribunal, on the basis of collected documents and witnesses' testimonies and on the principle of international law, judged the war started by the Japanese imperialists as a horrible, immoral crime for reducing Korean and other Asian people to slaves and as a brutal, predatory war and punished Tojo and other top-class war criminals.
   Are the Japanese statesmen and conservative politicians who are styling themselves "intelligent people" really unaware of this? They must be well aware of it. Their behavior is an act of brazen-faced militarists, a mockery of history and a challenge to the international community.
   Then, why are the rightist reactionaries of Japan embellishing the crime-woven history, totally challenging human morality?
   This is because they have still harboured the ambition for repeating the history of aggression and settling the "deep-seated grudge."
   Actually, Japan has frantically revived militarism over the past 50 odd years after the war in the hope of being revenged for its defeat.
   Japan, which has already become the second largest country in military expenditures, was provided with assurances by the united states through the review of the "defense cooperation guidelines" in September last year, the assurances of allowing it to militarily interfere in all issues of whole Asia, going beyond the far east. Now it is pushing ahead with legislative arrangements.
   Japanese militarism is not a departed spirit but already began revealing its true colors as aggressor and emerged as a dangerous hotbed of aggression in Asia.
   The militarists want to satisfy the century-old ambition for "Greater East Asia Coprosperity Sphere" at any cost.
   This is why the reactionaries have persistently negated the history of aggression and incited militarism.
   By doing so, they also seek to avoid a state compensation for the immoral crime committed by Japan in the past.
   Japan is a war criminal state which plunged Asia into disasters. In view of international law and morality, it is an unavoidable responsibility and obligation of the war criminal to make an apology and compensation to the victim.   
   In the past, Japan's high-ranking authorities expressed "regret" and "repentence" when they visited Asian nations. 
   But it is clear that such an empty talk which has been repeated over the past five decades is not enough to remove distrust of the international community and victims.
   What angers the international community is the attitude of the Japanese authorities steadily evading the state responsibility for the crime related to the "comfort women" issue.
   The issue should be solved in relationship between the  Japanese government, which is the perpetrator, and the "comfort women" who are victims. However, the Japanese authorities had the audacity to set up the "national fund" and try to flee from all the responsibility for the crime.
   This is the real features of Japan, which is boasting of its strong economy and seeking to become a political power.
   The Japanese reactionaries must clearly know that the settlement of the past is not a matter which they can handle willfully.
   Their continued immoral acts and delays in the settlement of the past will only aggravate the distrust of the international community and enlarge their compensation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on suppression in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on suppression in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- A few days ago, the South Korean puppets arrested students of Inje College and its graduates on the strength of the "National Security Law" for the mere reason that they formed a campus organisation called "independence ranks" with the Juche idea as the platform.
   Branding this arrest as an unjustifiable suppression of ideology, a fascist infringement upon free learning, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun today says:
   The immortal Juche idea is a great ideology which indicates the road of human liberation and national emancipation. Accordingly, it is a worldwide trend to study this idea.
   It is only too reasonable and natural for South Korean people to learn the Juche idea.
   However, the South Korean puppets are trying to prevent people from learning the Juche idea. Theirs is a foolish misdeed.
   They are hell bent on the suppression of the followers of the Juche idea, feeling fearful of this idea, an ideology of the world.
   This clearly proves that they have no prospects.
   We consider the brutal suppression of the Juche idea followers to be a challenge to and provocation against us.
   We will never remain a passive onlooker to this suppression.

articles.title: DPRK heroes in '90s
articles.content:
DPRK heroes in '90s
Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected guard unit no. 171 of the Korean People's Army on May 22.
   He called at the company of hero Kim Kwang Chol under the unit and showed high appreciation  again for the feat of the hero produced by the company in the '90s.
   Hero Kim Kwang Chol was a platoon leader who covered a hand grenade with his body at a critical moment to save his soldiers on military duty and died at the age 25.
   Following Kim Kwang Chol, the first DPRK hero in the '90s, many people's army soldiers devoted their youths and lives to feats without hesitation.
   Tens of DPRK heroes were produced for the last eight years.
   A pilot hero Kil Yong Jo laid down his life for the safety of the country and people under unexpected circumstances.
   Kil Kwang Sik, 60 days after he joined the people's army, took combat equipment  out of barracks on fire at the cost of his life.
   Kim Chang Bok, Han Yong Chol, Ryu Kyong Nam, Mun Jong Hwan and many other soldiers in their teens and twenties saved  a number of servicemen, combat equipment, lives and property of the people at the cost of their lives.
   DPRK heroes Kim Chol Jin and Jong Kwang Son remained true to revolutionary principles when they were detained by the enemy while drifting in the sea.
   Kim Jong Il made sure that their ardent patriotism, warm comradeship and noble spirit of self-sacrifice would be handed down through generations and their alma maters  were named after them. 
   The heroes live an eternal life.

articles.title: Immediate fighting slogan of NDFSK
articles.content:
Immediate fighting slogan of NDFSK
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- The National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) published an immediate fighting slogan, according to "Kuguk Jonson," an organ of the central committee of the NDFSK.
   The slogan said that although the regime was replaced in South Korea, the suppression continues.
   It called for removing the fascist violence against the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) and exploding the "Agency for National Security Planning."
   It laid stress on defending  Hanchongryon and maintaining the purity of the student movement.
   It called upon one million students to more closely unite around Hanchongryon and take the van in the movement for independence, democracy and reunification with an indomitable will and valor.

articles.title: Greetings to Yugoslav Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Yugoslav Prime Minister 
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, acting Premier of the Administration Council, sent a message of greetings to Momir Bulatovic upon his election as Prime Minister of Yugoslavia.
   The message wished him new success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Investment from Xiantong group
articles.content:
Investment from Xiantong group
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- Following the visit to Pyongyang at the end of February by a Chinese delegation from the Yanbian prefectural government, a delegation from the Chinese Xiantong group came to the Rajin-Sonbong area and made a survey for the reconstruction and modernization of the Rajin-Namyang railway line. It drew up a report and reached an agreement with the zone authorities regarding investment in this sector.
   According to the agreement, the reconstruction project of the railway line will start in July and will be completed in a year, thus raising the volume of rail freight by 14 times as much in 200

articles.title: CPRF vice-chairman on "north wind" case
articles.content:
CPRF vice-chairman on "north wind" case
 Pyongyang, June 3 (KCNA) -- O Ik Je, vice-chairman of the committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, was interviewd by KCNA today over the fact that the letter he sent to Kim Dae Jung last year during the Presidential Election campaign was used by the south korean authorities for the fabrication of the "north wind" case.
   He said:
   I sent a letter to Kim Dae Jung, President of South Korea's National Congress for New Politics, who stood for President at the end of last year.
   I was on intimate terms with Kim, wanted to support and inspire him.
   It is a matter of morality and courtesy which has nothing to do with politics that close friends encourage each other, irrespective of ideology and idea.
   From this point of view, it is only too natural and right that I, one of his old friends, sent him a letter with my sincerity.
   At that time, I never thought that my letter might be abused by any dishonest forces.
   Surprisingly, however, South Korea's "Agency for National Security Planning" (ANSP) intercepted my letter and used it for an ulterior political purpose. It is indeed an infringement upon my human rights.
   I denounce the misdeed of the "ANSP" as an unbearable infringement upon human rights and morality.
   I well know about the plot-breeding tool.
   I think that by doing so, the "ANSP" has fully revealed its despicable colors as a group of anti-north plotters and its immorality.
   The fact proves that the "ANSP" engaging in anti-north plots should be dissolved totally and immediately as demanded by all fellow countrymen.
   But the South Korean authorities are not only keeping it intact in such a way as renaming and readjusting it but planning to upgrade its position. This treacherous act adds to the crime.
   I, availing myself of this opportunity, lodge a strong protest with the south.
   It is the "ANSP" that committed the crime, but the south blames me and the north for it in connection with the "north wind." such a behavior of the south is really despicable.
   I urge the south to make an apology for the plot and stop the anti-north confrontation it is intensifying under the pretext of the case.
